newsitem.title: UK: Barclays unions vote for strike ballot.
newsitem.headline: Barclays unions vote for strike ballot.

text.p: The two main trade unions in Barclays Plc said on Friday that 86.6 percent of their members had voted to reject the British bank's pay proposal and would support a strike ballot.
The UNIFI and BIFU trade unions represent more than two-thirds of all Barclays staff, they said in a statement.

Staff at Barclays have been infuriated at the bank's plans to abolish Christmas bonuses and impose what unions say amounts to a pay and pension freeze on the majority of employees for the foreseeable future.

The trade unions said turnout for their ballot, which had been conducted over a two-week period, was unually high and reflected the very strong feeling of resentment staff had been expressing since Barclays announced its intentions.
Members of the union executive will meet next week to discuss their next move but said a strike ballot seemed unavoidable.

"I cannot see how an industrial action ballot can be avoided, given the strength of feeling expressed by our members today against the bank's proposal," said Bob Drake, assistant general secretary to the UNIFI.
